intro: Lampranthus flexifolius, commonly known as the Cape fuchsia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Lampranthus flexifolius is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
